description: From pre- +â€Ž cuneus, because it is located in front of the cuneus.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) A division of the medial surface of the parietal lobe of the cerebrum.
examples: The precuneus becomes less active during goal-directed cognitive or perceptual tasks, suggesting it is selectively reducing awareness of potentially distracting environmental factors (Gusnard and Raichle, 2001).
